1. Introduction

SpruceX is a lightweight HTML extension library that brings reactivity, state management, and modern features like SPA navigation and DOM morphing directly to your markup. It sits nicely between vanilla JS and heavier frameworks. 

<script src="https://unpkg.com/sprucex"></script>

<div sx-data="{ count: 0 }">
  <button sx-on:click="count++">Increment</button>
  <span sx-text="count"></span>
</div>

2. Attributes Reference

Core State & Binding

Attribute Description
sx-data Defines the component scope with an object literal or function.
sx-text Evaluates an expression and sets the element's textContent.
sx-html Evaluates an expression and sets the element's innerHTML.
sx-show Toggles the element's visibility (display: none) based on truthiness.
sx-bind:<attr> Binds an attribute value to a JS expression (e.g., sx-bind:src="url").
sx-class Conditionally applies CSS classes based on an object or string.
sx-model Two-way data binding for inputs. Modifiers: .number, .trim, .lazy, .debounce-ms.
sx-ref Registers the element in $refs with the given name.
sx-toggle Toggles a boolean property in the state on click.
sx-local Persists component state to localStorage using the value as the key.

Logic & Flow Control

Attribute Description
sx-for Iterates over an array (e.g., item in items) on a <template>.
sx-memo Memoizes sx-text or sx-html based on a dependency array.

Event Handling

Attribute Description
sx-on:<event> Attaches an event listener. Modifiers: .prevent, .stop, .self, .window, .document, key names.

Network & Requests

Attribute Description
sx-get/post/put/delete Defines the URL and method for the request.
sx-trigger Event that triggers the request (default: "click").
sx-target CSS selector indicating where to swap the response.
sx-swap Swap method: innerHTML, outerHTML, before, after, prepend, append, morph.
sx-vars Object defining variables for the URL template.
sx-include Selector for other inputs/forms to include in the request body.
sx-json-into Parses JSON response into the specified state path.
sx-optimistic Expression to update state immediately before request.
sx-revert-on-error Expression to revert optimistic update if request fails.
sx-poll Polling interval in milliseconds.
sx-poll-while Expression that must be true for polling to continue.

Navigation & Performance

Attribute Description
sx-page Marks the container for SPA navigation updates.
sx-boost Enables link prefetching on hover/focus.
sx-boost-on Events to trigger boost (default: "mouseenter").
sx-lazy Delays component init until it enters the viewport.
sx-animate Auto-animates children using @formkit/auto-animate.
sx-preserve Prevents element from being modified during morphing.
sx-key Unique key for identifying elements during lists/morphing.

Miscellaneous

Attribute Description
sx-error-fallback Content to display if an expression error occurs.

3. SPA Navigation

How it works

Add sx-page to your main content container. SpruceX will intercept all internal links, fetch the new page, and morph the content inside that container without a full reload.

History API DOM Morphing

Turbo Boosting

Add sx-boost to links or their containers to prefetch pages on hover, making navigation instant.

sx-boost sx-boost-on="mouseenter focus" Pre-fetching Cache aware

Events

Listen to sprucex:page-before and sprucex:page-after on the document to show loading bars or trigger analytics.

document.addEventListener('sprucex:page-before', ...)

4. Auto-Animate

Zero-Config Animations

Just add sx-animate to a parent element.

  • Automatic layout transitions
  • Smooth enter/leave animations
  • Works with sx-for and sx-show

Configuration

Pass a JSON object to sx-animate to customize.

  • sx-animate="{ duration: 500 }"
  • sx-animate="{ easing: 'ease-out' }"
  • sx-animate="{ duration: 200, easing: 'linear' }"

5. Holiday Themes

Seasonal SVG Decorations

Add festive flair to your logo or icons by conditionally showing holiday decorations based on the date.

Regular Logo

Holiday Logo (Dec-Jan) 

<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 128 128">
    <defs>
        <linearGradient id="spruceGrad" x1="0%" y1="0%" x2="100%" y2="100%">
            <stop offset="0%" stop-color="#10B981"/>
            <stop offset="100%" stop-color="#065F46"/>
        </linearGradient>
    </defs>

    <!-- Base Tree -->
    <path d="M64 16 L82 42 L74 42 L90 64 L80 64 L94 88 L34 88 L48 64 L38 64 L54 42 L46 42 Z" fill="url(#spruceGrad)"/>
    <rect x="58" y="88" width="12" height="14" rx="2" fill="#78350F"/>

    <!-- Holiday Decorations (visible Dec-Jan) -->
    <g class="holiday-decorations" style="display: none;">
        <!-- Star -->
        <polygon points="64,6 67,14 76,14 69,19 71,28 64,23 57,28 59,19 52,14 61,14" fill="#FBBF24"/>
        <!-- Ornaments -->
        <circle cx="64" cy="36" r="3" fill="#EF4444"/>
        <circle cx="52" cy="55" r="3" fill="#3B82F6"/>
        <circle cx="76" cy="55" r="3" fill="#EF4444"/>
        <circle cx="64" cy="75" r="3" fill="#A855F7"/>
    </g>
</svg>

<script>
    // Check if it's December or January
    const month = new Date().getMonth();
    const isHolidaySeason = month === 11 || month === 0;

    if (isHolidaySeason) {
        document.querySelector('.holiday-decorations').style.display = 'block';
    }
</script>

Using CSS Classes

Toggle a class on the parent element for cleaner separation: 

<style>
    .holiday-theme .holiday-decorations {
        display: block;
    }
    .holiday-decorations {
        display: none;
    }
</style>

<script>
    const month = new Date().getMonth();
    const isHolidaySeason = month === 11 || month === 0;
    document.getElementById('logo-container').classList.toggle('holiday-theme', isHolidaySeason);
</script>
